intro: Heracleum wilhelmsii, commonly known as the Himalayan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
